intro: Dendrocalamus liboensis, commonly known as the Liao River bamboo, is a tall, slender bamboo species native to southern China. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its strong, straight culms that can reach heights of up to 20 meters. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are typically green on top and pale underneath. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its rapid growth and robust structure, it is valued for both ornamental and practical uses.
